main event: A round flaming object with colors ranging from reddish-white to orange, along with a long smoke trail, was observed moving generally east to west on July 10, 1958.
interesting points: The object was reported almost simultaneously from multiple locations, including Hendersonville, Tennessee, and Scottsville, Kentucky,The sighting lasted approximately 15 seconds,The characteristics of the object are consistent with descriptions of a bolide or fireball,The report mentions that meteor showers may have been present at the time of the sighting,Weather conditions during the observation were clear with some thunderstorms in the vicinity.
sighted object: round flaming object with a long smoke trail
